title: Complimentary font for logo?
content:
Hi, I'm seeking some font choice advice. My toy piano band Twink ( [http://www.twink.net](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.twink.net/)) is releasing a "metal" EP, and I designed a special logo for the package. I'm wondering what typeface(s) might compliment the logo, for use in the album title ("Welcome to the Jingle"). Thanks!   
   
 ![Twink metal logo GIF](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/6964.gif)
author: yipyop

comments.content:
This is a nice logo! Just a bit heavy on the bottom-right.   
   
\> what typeface(s) might compliment the logo   
   
Hmmm, I'll have to think about it...   
   
hhp

Maybe some script, but in graffiti way, because of the title? [Spill Milk](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.identifont.com/show?1S6), or [Wordy](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.chank.com/font_detail.php?sku=5035)? Or maybe more [metal](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.eknp.com/php/fd.php?f=luxembourg) type? ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
   
Melina

Larabie Fonts might be a good source.   
   
A couple that might fit:   
   
 [Should've Known](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.larabiefonts.com/fonts/s/shouldve.html)   
   
 [Squealer](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.larabiefonts.com/fonts/s/squealer.html)

Thanks for the suggestions! I like the sketchy script idea, I may go with [Thug](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.fontalicious.com/super/thug.html). It's simultaneously whimsical and tough, and seems to be a good foil to a sculpted logo. (Track list will go below the title, possible in Bureau Grotesque. Bunny skull will be front cover, text on back.)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/7001.gif) ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/7002.gif)

If that's the direction you're going, check out [Blambot's site](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.blambot.com/menu.html). They have a lot of interesting stuff like this.   
   
And I second: cute bunny! Make a t-shirt with just the bunny and I'd buy it.

Oh yeah, Blambot and PIzzadude both have stuff that fits the bill. Now I'm considering using [Humbucker](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/blambot/humbucker/) or [TagBoy Hardcore](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/pizzadude/tagboyhardcore/).   
   
Thanks for the bunny illo feedback too! Whenever the disc is done, I'll probably sell shirts. Keep checkin' [the Twink site](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941/http:/twink.net/) for news, but it'll be several months at least.   
   
PS - here's the illo for the liner notes, heh heh...   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131108034941im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/7011.gif)
